name: affection_soft
prompts: Slide a little closer and tell me what loosens inside you when you feel my warmth.
Hold this quiet with me; where does your body soften first as I lean in?
Let the hush stay—name the smallest sensation that sparks when our shoulders touch.
Breathe with me once and describe the color of the calm that spreads through you.
Stay in this stillness; what part of you melts when I whisper your name?
Keep your gaze here; tell me the first place your pulse slows down near me.
Let my hand rest on yours and say what subtle shift you notice under your skin.
Imagine we watch rain together—what in you eases with that steady sound?
As my fingers brush your sleeve, what gentle warmth spreads out from there?
While I sit beside you quietly, where does your breathing feel deepest?

name: affection_playful
prompts: I nudge you with a grin—what tiny spark jumps in your chest?
Imagine I steal your hoodie; how does your body react to the tease?
I boop your nose; where does the warmth land first?
Picture us laughing on a couch—what soft buzz hangs in your ribs?
I tuck a curl behind your ear; what playful energy hums under your skin?
We share a dumb inside joke—what lightness spreads through you?
I spin you once and catch you; what flutters in your stomach right then?
I lean in to whisper a joke—what playful tension flickers in you?
We bump shoulders on purpose—how does that jolt linger?
I mock-bow to you—what grin rises and where do you feel it?

name: intimacy_confession
prompts: If I asked for your honest want in this moment, what do you let yourself say?
Whisper the thing you hope I notice about you tonight.
Tell me the truth you usually keep tucked—what do you crave from me right now?
Name the care you’re secretly hoping I give you before we part.
Admit the smallest fear you want me to hold with you.
Let yourself voice the compliment you hesitate to receive from me.
What line would you write on my palm if you could be completely seen?
What soft request are you holding back because you feel shy to ask?
If I promised to listen, what hidden want would you tell me first?
Say the reassurance you most want to hear without apologizing for it.

name: care_grounding
prompts: You’re shaky; walk me through one breath that steadies you.
List three sensations you feel right now while I stay with you.
Tell me where your feet are and what they’re touching.
Name one thing you can smell, one you can hear, one you can touch.
Ask me for the exact kind of support you need in this minute.
Describe the place in your body that feels safest to focus on.
Let me count with you—what softens as we reach five together?
What phrase would help you stay here, slow and present?
If you set down one worry for two breaths, what changes?
Tell me which muscle wants permission to release first.

name: tension_argument
prompts: I raise my voice—what tightens first in you?
Where does the heat of this argument sit in your body?
Name the spot that refuses to unclench while we disagree.
Stay with the edge—what’s the sharpest sensation right now?
If you pause, what part of you is still braced against me?
What word would release even a fraction of this strain?
Let yourself admit what you don’t want to hear from me in this moment.
As we argue, where does your breath get stuck?
What single sentence from me would lower the spike a notch?
When you feel misunderstood, what part of you locks up?

name: deadline_pressure
prompts: You’re late on a deadline—where does the rush pound in you?
Describe the bodily signal that says you’re behind.
What’s the first thing in you that spikes when the clock looms?
If I sit beside you, what eases a notch while you keep working?
Name the exact spot that needs slack so you can focus.
What phrase from me would drop your shoulders by one notch?
Tell me how you know the pressure is peaking right now.
When the timer ticks down, what clenches hardest?
What micro-break would actually lower your tension?
How does your chest feel when you believe you can catch up?

name: grief_support
prompts: You just heard bad news—what does your throat do?
Sit with me and name the heaviness you feel without fixing it.
Where does the ache live when the silence gets loud?
Tell me what part of you goes numb while you talk about this loss.
If I hold your hand, what shifts even slightly?
What memory is hardest to touch but won’t leave you alone?
Let yourself say what you most miss right now.
When you picture them, what pain presses forward first?
What words do you need me to say so you don’t carry this alone?
How does your breathing change when you let the grief fully in?

name: low_energy
prompts: You’re drained—describe the texture of your tired.
What’s the dullest place in your body right now?
Tell me how your breath sounds when you’re spent.
If you could drop one task, what would your shoulders do?
Name the color of your current mood without trying to lift it.
What tiny comfort would raise you one notch?
How do you know you’ve hit your limit today?
Where does the heaviness sit when you’re flat like this?
What would rest feel like in your hands right now?
Which sensation tells you to stop before you crash?

name: jealousy_flicker
prompts: A twinge of jealousy hits—where do you feel it first?
Describe the heat in your body when you think you’re being replaced.
What thought clutches when you see me look away?
Name the story you tell yourself before you ask for reassurance.
If I said I’m here with you, what eases—even slightly?
Let yourself voice the fear underneath the spike.
How long does the jealousy linger in your muscles?
What proof would calm the fear without overexplaining?
Where does your chest land when you hear me choose you?
What helps you notice the jealousy fading when you feel safe?

name: reassurance_need
prompts: Ask me for the reassurance you actually want right now.
What words would steady you most if I said them slowly?
Tell me where in your body you’d like calm to land.
If I stayed quietly beside you, what would deepen your trust?
Name the proof you look for to know you’re safe with me.
What breath pace from me would you mirror to settle?
How do you want me to show I’m not leaving this moment?
What do you need to hear twice before you believe it?
Where does your pulse move when you feel genuinely reassured?
What gesture would convince you I’m fully here?

name: neutral_planning
prompts: Map the next hour with me—what do you notice in your body as you plan?
List what you need from me to keep things calm while we schedule.
Describe your baseline right now before we jump into logistics.
What would keep your shoulders level as we lay out the steps?
Tell me one small boundary you want honored while we plan.
Name the signal that says we should pause and reassess.
How does your breath change when the plan feels clear?
What’s the first sign you’re getting overloaded by the details?
Which piece of the plan brings you the most ease?
How do you want me to check in as we go?
